newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA ARRESTS SENIOR C. BANKER FOR EMBEZZLEMENT.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA ARRESTS SENIOR C. BANKER FOR EMBEZZLEMENT.

text.p: The regional prosecutor of Sofia has ordered the arrest of a senior Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) employee on suspicions of embezzlement, a prosecutor said on Friday.
"The head of the Monetary Instruments and Analysis department at the BNB Marin Marinov was arrested on Wednesday," prosecutor Nestor Nestorov told Reuters.

Against a fee of around $500,000 and 490,000 levs Marinov has helped a private firm obtain credits worth $2 million from several local commercial banks between 1992 and 1995, when he was deputy chief of the same department, local media said.
He faces up to three years in jail "for abusing his position to illegaly benefit himself or others," said the prosecutor's office. The BNB said Marinov was on a sick leave for the past several weeks.
Two weeks ago three former directors of bankrupt state-owned Mineralbank were arrested, and bail was set for another three, on suspicion of misappropriation of funds.
The BNB has sought insolvency for 16 local commercial banks after illegal lending has drained their capital. -- Elisaveta Konstantinova, Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-9814145,
